message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.SY, cs.DC 

This paper discusses a framework for mitigating vulnerabilities in third-party libraries used by Firefox through sandboxing. This topic falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR) as well as software engineering (cs.SE) since the framework involves retrofitting isolation into an existing software system. The paper also mentions the use of static information flow enforcement and dynamic checks, which are related to programming languages (cs.PL) and control systems (cs.SY). Finally, the paper discusses the performance impact of the framework, which is related to distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC).
